name: Brindavan Gardens
chips: Spread over 60 acres, is located at a distance of 21 kms away from Mysore. Built across the notable river of India, Cauvery. The well-synchronised fountain show with music, boating and well-manicured grass with flowerbeds are some of the top experiences of Brindavan Gardens.

name: Mysore Palace
chips: An incredibly breathtaking example of Indo - Saracenic style of architecture, the Palace is a magnificent edifice located in Mysore. The facade of the palace is a harmonious blend of Hindu, Muslim, Rajput and Gothic styles which imparts it a regal quality. Needless to say, it is one of the most visited historical monument visited by both local and foreign tourists in India. Mysore Palace is renowned for its light & sound show and vibrant Dussehra celebrations.

name: Chamundeshwari Temple
chips: The Chamundeshwari Temple is a traditional Hindu temple located on the eastern edge of Mysore at the height of 1000ft on the Chamundi hills. Dedicated to and named after goddess Durga, the temple also has statues of Nandi and Mahishasura, the demon. Being one of the oldest temples in the palace city of Mysore, the temple is a must-visit attraction for the travellers.

name: Mysore Zoo
chips: Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens, also known as the Mysore Zoo is one of the best zoological gardens in India. The world's first caesarian section delivery performed on an elephant in Mysore zoo gave it global fame and recognition. It is one of the oldest and most famous zoos in India.

name: Buy in Mysore
chips: Mysore is famous for Silk, Mysore pak, Sandalwood products, Rosewood artefacts, Khadi cotton and Incense Sticks / Agarbattis.
